name: protea

a family of South African bushes with flowers, grown in gardens in warm parts of the world. There are different types of protea, many of which have pointed pink or red bracts (= leaves that look like flower parts) in a cup shape around the flowers: Proteas for the American cut-flower trade are grown in California. The king protea is the national flower of South Africa.
